TopicTitle: Finally. A flying, asymmetrical, Blohm und Voss style aircraft.

Articles.Content:
Javascript is disabled. View full album

Not as asymmetrical as I'd like, but I'll get there. Tried to build one of these before, and failed horribly. Now I'm starting to dabble in actual planes. Still working on a megarover project, but did this as sort of a break.

I'd like to push the crew pod out to the side even more. That I'll do at some point.

Also, merry Christmas!

Impressive as usual, Whackjob.

Nah. There's a million other people who have done planes better than I ever have. I'm playing catch-up in this area. I'm walking ground unfamiliar to me.

#EDIT: As an example, I have *never* flown an SSTO plane. For some reason, I can never achieve orbit.
I like the shark fin. Merry Christmas to you as well!

Nice. Have you tried using clipping to make it seem something it isn't? It can help with balance and lift by hiding the parts that balance everything. You don't need to use dev console if you know a few minor tricks that can have major impacts on your building style.

PS: Can help with the ssto problem if you give me some specifics of when you wipe out and what is happening at the time.

Nah. There's a million other people who have done planes better than I ever have. I'm playing catch-up in this area. I'm walking ground unfamiliar to me.

#EDIT: As an example, I have *never* flown an SSTO plane. For some reason, I can never achieve orbit.

I couldn't do something like this given a liftetime, haha.

This isn't Whackjob enough:(

Just for you, the Arsehauler II:

The reason I'm starting out small is because planes are new ground to me. I am not experienced in this area.
